p: Oviposition indices (Oi) for the three EOs were calculated as (O−C)/(O+C), where O was the number of eggs laid on treated plants, and C is the number of eggs laid on control plants [ 39]. Oviposition indices were compared using one-way ANOVA. As homogeneity of variances was not assumed (Levene’s test, p > 0.05), oviposition indices were separated using the Games–Howell post hoc test. Statistical analyses were performed in R 3.6.3 [ 40].
